About Gise\'s Cooking unit converter:
Welcome!!!
A.- How to use the app:

1.- Select the property to work with from the images on the top. Three properties are available: Weight, Volume and Temperature. They are displayed in that order. The property highlighted with the blue colour is the selected one.

2.- Once the property has been selected, click on the \"From\" and \"To\" scroll menus to select the units to convert from and to, respectively. Depending on the property selected, different units will be displayed on the scroll menus.

3.- Enter a value in the box at the left of the \"Convert\" button, that value will correspond to the value of the unit to convert from. Positive and negative decimal numbers are allowed for Temperature property.
4.- Click on the \"Convert\" button to get your result on the \"Result\" message box.
B.- Tips:
1.- If any data to be input is missing, the app will prompt you a message.
2.- The \"DEL\" button will delete the last digit from the input box.

3.- The \"CLEAR\" button will clear the input box and display the hint message and the result box will be cleared and will display the \"Result\" text. The \"From\" and \"To\" scroll menus will not be cleared and current selection will remain.

4.- The \"+/-\" button allows to toggle between positive and negative numbers and vice versa. This button can only be used when the Temperature property has been selected, as transforming negative magnitudes of weight and volume does not make any sense.Negative sign can be set, even when the input box is empty and has no numerical value yet. Negative values are only possible for Celsius and Fahrenheit scales, since Kelvin is an absolute scale, which minimum point is zero.
